answers.answer: If the increased water intake is temporary than there probably is no need to worry.  Increased water drinking can occur with a change in food, change in environment, such as putting on the air conditioning or heat.  Or, if it is just hotter or dryer outside.However, increased water intake could signify a change in your cats body.  Diabetes, urinary tract infections, kidney disease, liver problems, and others can cause increased water drinking as an early symptom.  ...If in doubt, check it out.
